author: Shakera
title: Missed miscarriage
body:
At 7/8 weeks of my pregnancy my GP sent me to City Hospital in Birmingham to get a drip because she found a lot of ketones in my blood and said I was dehydrated which could cause miscarriage. Went to City Hospital and they checked my urine again and said only a tiny amount of ketones is showing which is normal so went home thinking it’s nothing. They were gonna give me anti sickness but I was too unwell to wait to for hours so went home.  
Tried to speak to a doctor before leaving to find out the name of the anti sickness so I could get it from my GP, but two staff members spoke to me so rudely and I said I needed to wait or go back to A&E if I’m not feeling well. One of them tried to help but she wasn’t from that area so couldn’t do much.  
I went for my first midwife appointment at 13 week. They took blood from me to check for sickle cell and thalassaemia in baby etc. Told my midwife I had brown stains in my underwear, midwife assured me it was nothing as long as it’s not blood. Went home thinking everything is fine. Next day I had my first dating scan in Sandwell Hospital and I remember seeing spotting in my underwear looked slightly red, didn’t think anything of it.  
At my scan found out my baby had no heartbeat and I had a miscarriage, My baby died at 8 weeks 5 days. Was referred to City Hospital, where I received advice on what could be done next. Sent me home with medicine management tablets to start at midnight but was bleeding a lot at home and advised not to take them later on and let nature take its course. Had cramps all night which came and went. Gave delivery to baby next day and was able to see baby clearly in sanitary pad.  
Around night time I had the worst pain, which didn’t go away. It was worse than the pain I had before. Went to Sandwell A&E. Receptionist could see I was in a lot of pain and couldn’t care less. Nurses took me in but spoke to me like what I was going through was nothing. Acted like I’m a burden to them and told me and my partner we should’ve gone to City Hospital. Saw me in a lot of pain and gave pain relief which didn’t help. Nurses kicked me out of the room back into the waiting area saying they needed the bed space and I need to sit down but I told them I was struggling to sit down.  
Left the hospital and went City Hospital instead, because of being treated badly. I was seen in 10/15 minutes at City Hospital and received pain relief via cannula. Pain went after few hours and I went to sleep for a bit. Doctor came and asked what happened, then said I could go home and said I could buy buscopan over the counter for pain if it comes back.  
The care was slightly better at City Hospital but still not great. I wish we actually had nurses and doctors who actually cared, but I guess they’ve become desensitised as they’re always dealing with people. This was our first pregnancy and I feel so traumatised from the experience. I pray people don’t have to go through such treatment and have better care given especially when they’re pregnant!

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

author: smirk832
title: I will be forever grateful for DIT treatment
body: I underwent DIT treatment with IAPT for 16 weeks. I was originally at a point of complete darkness, a victim to my own behavioural and thinking patterns. Mehnaz did an absolutely formidable job pushing me, challenging me, and empathising with me and my trauma to discover why my patterns are the way they are. We then worked towards identifying the triggers and how to make sure I don't allow myself to overthink, and ultimately increase my self-worth. I wouldn't change a thing about my time with her and the method of which we approached things. She managed to see the whole person that I am, and successfully broke down my defensive barriers to let her help me. I will be forever grateful.

author: izarfb94
title: Antenatal Care from Diabetes Enhanced Care Team in Labour Suite
body: We was happy with labour special with the midwife Jane thank you for everything for help here

author: encryptiondf77
title: Cancer scare
body: I went to the doctors first as had found a lump in my neck also very bad chesty cough which doesn't seem to vanish at all. Had covid and can't shake off fatigue or flu feeling. Sent for a X-ray whist I had Covid so changed the appointment for 10 days later . Told I may go to CT scan as well . Had both on a Friday . Had results from doctors then got phone call to say needed PET scan. Had and week later results. I've got red dots and two areas not active . So having antibiotics and inhaler and another scan to see if infection or area of red dots changes also my lungs . If no change then will check further details for cancer and long covid . My whole experience has being just over 6 weeks long . But only a calendar mth due to covid which I had to recover from . Can't fault the service or care I received.

author: Fifer in his 30's
title: Getting my coronavirus and flu vaccinations
body:
I visited the NHS Fife vaccination centre in Kirkcaldy’s High Street to get my coronavirus and flu vaccinations.  
It was a seamless experience.  
My sincere thank you to the staff for looking after me during a very comfortable visit.

author: skywb64
title: Being able to see my husband.
body: This virtual call has been a real life line for me as I haven't been able to visit my husband which has been so hard for both of us. We have been married for 54 years and never been apart. Thank you so much for giving us the opportunity to talk.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: AyrshireActor
title: Ayr Hospital Station 14
body: Elderly relative's care and lack of communication from staff , My gran fell on the ward in the evening, and a family member wasn’t contacted until late afternoon the next day? Surely this isn’t acceptable and should be investigated and the lack of communication issue needs to be further addressed.

author: Abisz74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Value your face-to-face approach
body:
Do extremely well  
Value your face to face approach  
Absolutely 100% marvellous system  
Do not believe there is anything else to improve on  
Very charming and helpful, to the point but never rushed  
Found to be less stressful  
Sad to see them go  
Reminds us of how medical services used to be

title: Excellent service
body: I was referred by my GP for a suspected cyst and to rule out that it was nothing more sinister. From the moment I arrived to the moment I left, I was treated with dignity, professionalism and most of all fantastic care from everyone I saw and spoke to. Most importantly, each and everyone one of them reassured me and made me feel at ease throughout the whole experience. Thank you. A special thank you to the individuals of the Breast Clinic team who took the time and consideration the previous week that put the wheels in motion for me to have the thorough investigations that I had today. Amazing team that do a fantastic job.

title: end of life care
body: Mum admitted to l5 via a and e, and eau. She had respiratory issues for which all staff worked very hard. Contacted by the lady doctor regularly with updates. In hospital over 2 weeks during which time end of life care discussed. Palliative care efficiently organised. Transport co-ordinator helped to move her back to care home where she sadly passed away peacefully. The care, compassion, and dignified work ethic was beyond the family's expectations. In the circumstances, nothing more could have been done. Mum was 92 during her admission. Thank you.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Yet Another Delay
body: We needed a form filling in for an insurance claim, evidently this has now been outsourced to another company which when you phone takes an age to get through.

title: I am so impressed with Hilltops!
body:
I just wanted to say that every time I have needed your service, you have been super quick at answering my query and got me the help that was needed.  
I have contacted the Doctors several times recently and the service has been the same each time with friendly  helpful staff.  
Thank you

title: Excellent care by all the staff
body:
I would just like to leave a review as I was so impressed by my visit . All the staff were so helpful and friendly , the nurses and consultant . They went out of their way to make me feel at ease and calm . I was treated with respect and care throughout . This hugely helped me not feel anxious snd have my needs understood .

Thanks you so much

title: Attention to detail
body: Tests on my extremely cold feet to determine blood flow were very thorough and the results were painstakingly explained to me by a most considerate medic, leaving me reassured. What’s more, I arrived ten minutes before my appointment and was seen immediately. A very good experience. Thank you nurse; well done.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Great practise
body: Very polite and curtious staff, quick and efficient service, tranquil waiting area, would recommend to anyone.

title: Urgent GP
body: Telephoned surgery, spoke to the most helpful lovely receptionist, who got a GP to call me back within an hour! Thank you!

title: Excellent service for my neighbour
body: My elderly neighbour rang this morning feeling unwell, but I had to get to a meeting in the city centre.  I tried ringing and would have been number 6 on the waiting list so I went into the surgery and asked reception staff to arrange for a doctor to ring my neighbour and to visit later in the day.  This worked wonderfully well, and my neighbour was very grateful for the speedy attention – as was I!  Thanks to you all!

title: Superb experience
body:
I can’t thank the rei team enough. Calm, totally professional and simply superb. I owe you my eyesight.
From first experiencing issues on Friday evening, to calling rei on Saturday morning, to being seen Sunday morning and treated immediately for a retinal tear, through to follow up on Wednesday afternoon, everything was brilliant. 
The rei was reassuringly calm, putting me at ease at a worrying time. Everything was done quietly and efficiently. I never had to wait anywhere for more than 5 minutes.
I’ve never experienced care or service anything like it.
Huge respect to you all and my heartfelt thanks.

title: Consistently fab
body: Last visit was for covid booster and flu jabs. I'm not great with needles and asked each team not to talk about the process but just do it. They did well to distract me, do the deed quickly and not make me feel silly, but even make me laugh.

title: Very positive experience
body:
Visited twice in the past fortnight and had exceptional service both times from the Receptionist and the lady doctor who I saw. Very thorough and very pleasant. An asset to your Practice. 
Thank you Issa Centre.

title: Amazing nurses
body: The practice nurses are absolute gems! So kind and patient, I've been going twice a week for the last few months and been so anxious - they've really helped me feel a lot better and are clearly fantastic at what they do seeing the progress of my healing. Thank you!

title: A very friendly place with brilliant staff,…
body:
On a short stay, just found that all member of staff, were helpful and kind.
I would suspect, a very happy place to work ,and to be treated.

title: Lovely staff and service.
body: Went for an appointment here and the doctor and staff were lovely. Very nice and helpful. Explained things very well and assisted me just as needed.

title: Great Practice
body: Always find the staff, both medical and admin, helpful and friendly.   Recent visit was no different with doctor assuring me that I could ask and discuss anything.

title: Excellent patient care
body: I just wanted to leave a review for a positive experience I had at the surgery. I did have to be very quick on ask my gp in order to submit my request but the care I received was excellent. The practice is clearly under immense pressure but the GP who I saw was so lovely and reassuring and didn’t actually have a break so I was able to be seen. Reception staff also very helpful. Thank you.

title: Great Practice
body: Always find the staff, both medical and admin, helpful and friendly.   Recent visit was no different with doctor assuring me that I could ask and discuss anything.

title: Fantastic staff
body: Although my operation does not appear to have been successful the nurses that looked after me whilst I was in there for 4 days were wonderful, so overworked and understaffed and yet fully committed to looking after all of the patients

readBy.name: Plymouth University, BSc (Hons) Urgent and Emergency Care 2022

title: Excellent Team
body:
I had hysteroscopy today and was so pleasantly surprised by the care and treatment of the staff. The doctor was a knowledgeable professional, really fantastic and the nurses and supporting staff are 1st class. 

They made me feel human, keep up the good work!

title: Absolutely useless surgery
body:
My 7 year old daughter collapsed one day, just blacked out for what felt like a very long time and the doctor at this surgery couldn't have been any less interested. Didn't want to see her, just relied on the paramedics examining her at the time it happened, and didn't invite her in for further examination. On the phone he suggested blood tests, though he didn't have a clue how to book children's urgent blood tests and asked me to contact stepping hill, who they kept insisting urgent blood tests had to be referred by the doctor. Back and forth for over a week with stepping hill and the doctor, who was none the wiser in how to book them. I was basically his secretary for the week making enquiries by calling numerous departments at stepping hill on how to book these blood tests, I'd pass the numbers, references etc to the Dr who couldn't be bothered to give the numbers a call. A week later I managed to get a blood test for my daughter, through no help from the doctor, purely for a woman at stepping hill feeling sorry for me doing this amount toing and froing and I got a cancellation. Bearing in mind he still hadn't seen my daughter and all the while I was concerned of her blacking out on me again, though he did make a comment that she's at school now so she can't be that bad.

Can't fault the receptionists here, every one of them was so helpful and understanding even though I was pestering them daily to get the Dr to call me, they always remained professional and sympathetic towards my frustrations. Sadly, I can't say the same about the Dr who I was made to feel like I was the biggest inconvenience for troubling him and spoke to me like I was in the wrong for having concerns about my daughter. Safe to say, I've moved surgery! Good luck to the rest of you still registered at this practice

title: Lovely staff
body: I came in for surgery on my left elbow, I cannot fault my treatment or day. I was made to feel very welcome and comfortable the nurses, doctor and everyone else  were excellent!

title: A history of failure
body:
I have been a patient to this practise since it merged with the Denbigh str. surgery around  february 2015, Denbigh street was a lovely surgery with 3 doctors you could trust.

My primary breast cancer was diagnosed in march 2015 and I went through the whole protocol in a nhs hospital, It left me extremely worn out and fatigued and I did ask for help continuosly but all I was told is that there is no cure for chronic fatigue and most of the time I felt I was not believed. In October 2019 I noticed that there was something growing under my ribs because I could feel it. It turned out that the cancer had spread to the liver and it was as big as an orange. 

What do all these doctors study for so many years I do not know, nobody ever though of a recurrence in a patient with a previuos history.

 The day I went to have my diagnose explained the doctor though it was the right time to fill the 'end of Life care' form. I suppose they saw me as already dead or just about. It was ghastly.

 Then there was Covid and it was as it was. 

 In April 2021 I went to see a surgeon privately, he advised me to get a cancer transfer of care to another NHS hospital that would have offered better care than what I was getting. It turned out that for this surgery a "cancer transfer of care is an extremely complicated thing" and they took months and months. One of the reasons I was given is that the hospital I wanted to be transferred 'was not on the drop down menu'.... 

In March 2022 I changed surgery, so that I could hopefully find someone that could do the 'cancer transfer of care for me' and you know what? they managed without problem. I m now being treated to the nearest hospital I wanted and the new GP is a lovely lady who know how to interact with people and the administrative staff just work better.

 I wish I had changed surgery a very long time ago. 

Everything is on my files and can be checked, I am still a stage 4 breast cancer patient with a poor prognoses but at least I am feeling better looked after.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Loved my experience
body: Would love to thank the team of midwife’s I had during my experience here two weeks ago. I know when you write your birth plan it mostly never happens but I got everything I dreamed of. Huge thank you to the lovely team I had for making my experience what I wanted. Would highly recommend having your baby here and the birthing pool was dreamy.

title: Wonderful care, results and staff!
body: Everything from start to finish was fantastic, I could not have been looked after better and the results are wonderful. I would wholeheartedly recommend SpaMedica at Edge Lane to anyone.

title: Excellent Service
body: The whole process was made very easy due to the amazing staff who showed great professionalism. Kindness and attention to detail and I would highly recommend to anyone who has to have cataract treatment,From the the first appointment  the to the operation was only a matter of three weeks . Excellent .

title: Good company
body: Abdominal ultra scan very professional very friendly absolutely spot on with time of appointment overall good service.

title: Difficult to get appointments
body:
I have been with this practice for over 25 years, and not had no real problems until this last year. It is difficult to book an appointment, you have to phone in at 8.30, nearly impossible to get through and if you do, appointments have gone, then you can't book an appointment you have to call back the next day and go through the same.
I am at present on the phone now and have been no 1 in the call cue for 45 minutes how can this be?
This policy needs to change.

title: Is this how the NHS is going
body:
I tried to phone at the very minute of the practice opening ie 8 .30 told it’s busyI then rang 15 or more times till 8.45 still busy , then at 8.50 rang and told 6 in line when eventually got through no appointments ring at 12 
So I go online still no appointments , I went for a blood test and guess what. An empty waiting room, what is going on ?

title: The last place I would ever want to visit again.
body:
I visited the A&E on two occasions regarding the same issue. It altogether took ridiculous hours (I think 8 altogether). They were completely overwhelmed with the number of patients, understaffed  
 and clearly not coping. To add insult to injury, the prescription was handwritten in such illegible fashion, it could not be realized at my local pharmacy, because the pharmacist couldn't even figure out what was prescribed, and the dose was a hieroglyphic squiggle. 
The pharmacist tried to contact the hospital to no avail and had to give up after 45 minutes, because they were closing. I tried to contact the hospital for 2 days, just being shuffled about and stonewalled. I phoned my GP, and it became alarmingly clear there was no prescription mentioned on my discharge form. It finally took either 111 or patient advice service to get to the hospital and receive assurance I can pick up my medication the next day (remains to be seen how this will work). 
No apologies, absolutely none. I was treated like an obnoxious nuisance, not an ill patient with a real issue.
Just dreadful.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

author: DebMac
title: Royal infirmary of Edinburgh cryoablation
body:
I just wanted to thank everyone in the day case admission unit for their amazing care today.  
I was extremely nervous for my treatment today but Mr Grubb, Claire, Ann and all other staff, the lovely porter and the HCSW’s all made me feel more as ease and really looked after me. I do apologise for forgetting the other staff nurses name. I hope not to return, but if I do I would be very comfortable in your care xx

title: Excellent GP practice
body: There are often negative remarks made about this practice but I have always found them excellent.  Again had a phone call follow up consultation which was perfect.  Thank you

title: A Very Well Run Practice
body: Very easy to get an appointment to see a Doctor or Nurse.Very friendly reception.I do not like phoning the surgery as phone lines are very busy so i like to book in person. Went in to see the Doctor today for a quick chat to ease my mind came out very reassured that the Doctor had everything in hand.I have never had any problems with any of the staff at the surgery.This is a top class surgery

title: Great care
body: This is an absolutely phenomenal doctors surgery. The receptionists are kind and warm and take the time to listen, the doctors are friendly and caring. I really feel as though I’ve found a gem in this surgery. Thank you for your hard work.

title: Flu jab
body: I had a timed appointment for my flu jab. I arrived at my allotted time and went straight in. The staff were very friendly and helpful - the whole process was extremely efficient. This particular experience is consistent with the treatment and care I have had over many years as a patient of the practice.

title: Excellent
body: I have recently moved to the area and am delighted to find a GP who is so professional and who genuinely seems to care about her patients. Would highly recommend this practise (although it did take some time to figure out the technology!).

title: Very pleased.
body: I was very grateful to have today appointment in advanced because of a cancellation. I was seeing by my rheumatologist, she was very attentive about my problems and advised me about the medicines and treatment to follow. I should be seeing her in about 3 months time.

title: Friendly and efficient
body: Arrived early by a few minutes. Calked in at exactly the time of my appointment. Friendly nurse. Great service.

author: grace88x
title: Professional, caring staff
body:
I was sent to Urgent Care in Omagh by my GP to get an xray of my foot, as I had stood on glass and it had went into my left foot. I could not walk on it.  
From filling in my details at reception it was only 10 minutes until the nurse called me to access the situation, and in no time I was sent to xray. After that I waited for a short time and the senior nurse called me in and froze my foot and squeezed it and removed the 2 mm piece of glass.  
I was so relieved, they patched me up and gave me extra dressing and advice. My entire visit was quick, only in one and a half hours, and professional, caring staff. Thank you to the staff of Omagh Urgent Care today.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Too long for answers
body: It doesn't matter if you're waiting for blood test, X-ray or MRI scan results - you just can't get an answer if the G.P. has to comment on them (month long waits, making continuous phone calls).  Reception staff and nurses are excellent though!

title: Useless
body: Again, as I struggle to call the surgery I have had to wait to visit the surgery to discuss a diabetic review.  Only dates available are dates I cannot make and need to have a prescription item reviewed but need another appointment for that to be done and have to wait 10 days for a telephone call on the review.  Just hope I can stretch out the blood test strips to last until the prescription is sent and available for collection from the pharmacy.

author: sj2
title: A calming, friendly space
body: The doctor sent me here, I rushed on my way to work. It was a calming, friendly space. I was seen quickly and treated as an adult with care. It felt like a good experience

author: ospreyqb53
title: Simple terminology
body: Just to say how wonderful the ambulance team, the A & E team and Dr Abdola are. I took a turn last week which I now know was a TIA and everyone was so caring. After being admitted as an emergency and looked after, I was asked to return to see Dr Abdola who was kind, reassuring and explained things to me in simple terms that I could understand

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Treatment
body:
My G P referred me to A&E and i cannot compliment them enough
I was seen and assessed had all necessary tests and it all ran very smoothly ,i have since had a follow up phone call with contact number and full explanation for further tests
A&E in hospitals is always getting bad press but i really cant Thank the Staff enough for their care and attention

title: Good service once you make contact
body: It took me over an hour on hold to speak to somebody, and I rang in the quieter time. Once I got through they were very efficient and helpful.

title: Unprofessional feedback from doctors
body: My brother was a patient at Wotton Lawn for 6 weeks. I am next of kin and my brother asked that doctors kept me abreast of treatment etc. In those 6 weeks not once did a doctor phone me to update me or ask for additional information. I have requested at least half a dozen times, if not more, for a doctor to either phone or email me regarding my brother's treatment and diagnosis. To no avail! I find this very unprofessional as well as negligent.

title: Terrible service
body: They couldn't register me for 6 weeks with a gp. I really needed to see a doctor but they kept saying that we register you in a few day. But it still didn't happen.

author: courageec76
title: Help at home
body: My husband has been having visits from Gillian the Occupational Therapist and we wanted to say thank you to her and the team. Very helpful and caring, getting equipment supplied and fitted has been a big help. She seemed to realise what was needed before we asked and sorted everything out.

title: Superb Treatment
body: Used the clinic for cataract operation. From start to finish the process was excellent. The pre op, the actual operation and the de-brief were all excellent with everything explained and really pleasant staff who made things as comfortable as possible. Indeed all the staff, not just the medical team were fantastic.

title: Superb
body: My adult daughter was admitted to pod3 critical care with head injuries. She has learning difficulties and autism Wow! The staff here are amazing! So supportive of my daughter’s additional needs. So compassionate and clear in all their communications with us. Lots of staff dealt with her and every one of them gave this level of care. Even on the difficult days. I could go on more but definitely made the worst days of our lives easier to deal with

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Great service
body:
I spoke to the GP today with a fairly standard complaint and found his telephone manner to be completely uplifting
Due to the calm and reassuring responses I received, I was able to consult with him aboout sensitive issues I had avoided for some time.
I cannot express how much better I felt before I even collected my prescription.
I think Gp,s are under so much scrutiny in the current climate..
We owe a debt of gratitude to those that are sticking with us to
Provide such outstanding practice Thank You!!

author: VirtualVisitingOfficer
title: ICS OT and Physio, Newry and Mourne
body:
I would like to convey my appreciation of the care I received from the team of physiotherapists who attended to me on my discharge from Daisy Hill Hospital.  
I was recovering from a broken hip, shoulder and wrist. The physios and support workers who called on a regular basis (Grainne, Susan and Chloe) provided me with help and care which was second to none. I am 94 years old and with their help I can now get around with the aid of a rollator. Emma, the Occupational Therapist, was also very helpful.  
I feel very appreciative of the care provided. Many thanks to all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Superb service
body: Booked an appointment for the same day, seen on time, diagnosis made and medicine prescribed quickly, and then dispensed within 5 minutes at the surgery. Wonderfully efficient, and done with a smile.  Thank you so much.  Keep up the great work.

title: Terrible practice
body: Went in for my flu jab today after being originally being told I wasn’t entitled ! Which was wrong as I am entitled with my health condition then while in there wanted an appointment which I was asked why and what did I need the appointment for I said it was my health condition and she wanted more information it is a joke it was personal and I didn’t want to talk in the reception  area I was told I could have one two weeks from now and I would get a confirmation which I haven’t had I only want to talk to a doctor it is disgusting how patients are being treated at this practice . Been with this practice for at least40 years this is the worst I have know it .

author: aurigard55
title: An amazing experience
body:
An amazing experience through the labour ward for an Elective C.section with my second son.  
The professionalism and organisation was clear from the minute we were admitted by Sister McAllister and chatted to anaesthetist Dr McKay. And the care, compassion and commitment shown by Dr McNulty & Dr Smyth, incredibly skilled team! Thank you for everything!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: I rarely used the gp prior to having my child toward the end of 2021- since then I have been in contact numerous times due to jabs and  the usual child ills as well as various post pregnancy related issues for myself;  each time I have found the staff (receptionists, nurses and of course Gps) so courteous, thoughtful, and reassuring In their care. I have never been made to feel silly or that I was wasting anyone’s time, I have always felt listened to and that the highest level of care has been afforded to us as a family. I have always got an appointment when needed and most importantly have been treated with respect and supported.

title: Wonderful staff
body:
Sirona nurses provided a very high standard of end-of-life care to my mum. All the nurses were caring, compassionate, patient and good humoured. As well as caring for mum, they were happy to spend time supporting our family by explaining how to help mum and what to expect.
The only bad bit about our experience was the telephone line. A couple of nights when we really needed to talk to someone, we were unable to get through. This was very distressing!

title: 95 year old waiting for hours in wheelchair
body:
I followed an ambulance from my mother’s care home around lunchtime on Tuesday 8th November. She has Alzheimer’s is 95 and very frail. I stayed with her to reassure her, be a comfort to her and explain what was happening. The staff were very good and caring. After blood tests and an X-ray she was deemed fit to be discharged and I was told she would be taken back to the care home by ambulance. This seemed very necessary as she had even struggled to sit up to be dressed, was unable to walk and I didn’t think it safe for me to take her in my car, especially as it was dark and raining and  I am unfamiliar with the area. 
I left just after 5pm after she had been transferred to a wheelchair. She had only had one biscuit to eat since her breakfast but I knew that the care home staff would look after her.
Imagine my distress the following day when I visited her to find that she had arrived back at the care home at 2.30 in the morning. She must have been sitting in a wheelchair for 9 hours. She is 95, with back problems and always wants to be lying down. If I had been told it was likely to be hours, I would have got staff to help her into my car and would have managed somehow rather than let her suffer like that.

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Vascular Surgery Managers Sees Numbers Not People
body: Last year I had a surgery at the Vascular Lab and didn't go well. Since February 2022 my leg hurts daily and some days are hard. I managed to get an appointment with the surgeon in early August; and today I was eagerly going to meet him again to discuss what to do next. Then my appointment got cancelled at last minute and I was re-booked in 3 months time. The secretary told me that it was the managers decision to cancel today's appointments in the clinic and that there aren't free bookings until February. I am feeling frustrated because my pain is daily and these managers just condemned me to 90 extra days of pain. As it's not they that are suffering and in pain, it's easy to play and juggle with others discomfort where patients are numbers and not people.

author: violetmt93
title: Kind and considerate staff
body:
I have been a patient at the hospital for the last 10 years. Occasionally I have to be treated for skin cancer. In July this year I attended for a routine check up and they found something suspicious, the nurse said I would be needed to be seen by the specialist with the possibility of freezing it out. I had travelled 55 miles to the hospital and so rather than make me return I had a 20 minute wait and was seen by the specialist who said that they would need to do a small operation and cut it away.  
Again, the staff took into consideration my travel needs and they spoke with David in the dermatology and minor operations unit, he agreed that if I didn’t mind waiting he would fit me in during what should have been his lunch break.  
I was asked to wait, given a cup of coffee and then I had the procedure done. It was very successful.  
Very grateful to all the staff for their kindness and consideration, they went above and beyond to help me and all were lovely.

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

title: Superb
body:
I was treated like a vip from the start of my treatment until the finish.
Very kind and professional staff, Would not hesitate to recommend it to friends and family.

title: Exceptional care
body:
I just wanted to praise everyone who works at Frome Medical centre, I’ve always received the most exceptional care. From the nurse who supported me through my Fibroadenoma and made me feel comforted and confident I was getting the best care, to the mental health team to GP’s who always do as much as they can with the limited time they have.
I really don’t think you get the recognition you deserve

author: corvusmp78
title: All the staff deserve a massive thank you
body: From the minute I entered hospital, FVRH, the staff were so professional whilst being under tremendous stress and strain. They made me feel so comfortable whilst going through my diagnosis and final treatment. All the staff deserve a massive thank you.

title: Absolutely unhelpful reception staff
body: I received a text message last week from 'GPSurgery' saying my GP surgery inviting me for a free NHS health check and to book an appointment using the link. As the link expired, the information on the page advised me to contact the GP to book an appointment. The receptionist whom I spoke to was absolutely unhelpful and arrogant. Just didn't want to help, on my face told me that I am not even eligible for the health check and as to why the GP would send a msg to me when I am not eligible. She was extremely rude and shut the phone on my face saying there was no record at all showing that they have sent such a msg. The msg is clearly from 'GPSurgery'. The doctors at the surgery are really good and the reception staff on the other hand are extremely horrible, arrogant and very unhelpful.

title: Amazing Doctors and  Great Staff
body: I don't know where I would be without the service that corner place provides. And a big thank you to a very special Doctor that made such a difference to my life and still does. And all the doctor's and  staff for all your help over the years it's very much appreciated.

title: Great help
body: Rang today in pain, receptionist did all they could to get me a phone call that evening. Doctor I spoke to was super helpful and got me into the practice within 30 minutes to see a doctor in person and once in the surgery another doctor spend over 30 minutes helping me, explaining what was happening and helping set up tests and working to get my prescription that evening.

title: Shambles
body: Tried for 2 weeks to get an appointment same every day no appointments left by the time you get through went into surgery at 8.10am to be told again no appointments available some of the receptionist need to learn how to speak properly to people they are rude and ignorant to your needs this surgery has gone so down hill needs closing no care for anyone in the last week I know of 5 people who have changed surgeries so if you want to be seen and cared for avoid Elmwood Medical practice

title: Helpful response
body: I have just spoken to woodcote medical practice about a  slightly complicated situation re medication dosage and prescription. This involved ensuring there was an increase dose and that it was available to be collected at a location other than a local pharmacy. The staff member I spoke to was extremely helpful and understanding. The situation has been promptly resolved and has made a difference to my day and others in my family. Thank you

title: Superb Team
body:
If you want cheering up during these dismal, gloomy times go and spend a day with the lovely team in Day Surgery!
Friendly, welcoming, attentive, dedicated and all extremely knowledgeable. 
I particularly enjoyed the singing along to Smooth fm!
Thanks for the lovely day guys and I’m feeling better already!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

author: Debscov65
title: My hysterectomy journey
body:
I had a full hysterectomy at the RAH in Paisley under the care of Dr Naheed (cervix, womb, tubes and ovaries removed).  
The journey to get to this point was very much supported and informed by the wonderful Dr Naheed.  
I had been bleeding very very heavily for many months following life changing HRT commencing to manage some many unpleasant symptoms. I was referred to Gynaecology and my first appointment was at the Vale of Leven Hospital. A doctor there decided to do a hysteroscopy and fit a marina coil. The doctor was unable to proceed as they were unable to get through the cervix.  
I was then sent for a hysteroscopy and for a marina coil as a day patient to have it done under general anaesthetic. This time I attended as a day patient to the RAH hospital in Paisley. When I came around from the surgery, I was very lucky to meet Dr Naheed, who was my surgeon. She took time to carefully explain that the operation had been unsuccessful, as they had been unable to get through my cervix. She was very calm and knowledgeable and put me at ease, taking time to ensure that I understood what had happened and why, and what my next steps were.  
Dr Naheed arranged an MRI SCAN and telephoned me to go through the results in detail and to discuss my options, again making sure I understood all the options going forward. I was then booked in for a full hysterectomy under the care of Dr Gupta, but with Dr Naheed as well.  
I went into the ward the week before to meet with Dr Naheed and sign the consent papers. Again, she gave me her time and made sure all my questions and concerns were answered.  
After the operation I saw Dr Naheed and she spent some time explaining the procedure and what had happened - she also showed me some photos which I found really reassuring. My specimens have been sent to histopathology and Dr Naheed will write to me with the results when they are known.  
DR Naheed is an exceptional doctor. She has many skills, but I wanted to especially mention her absolute skill, empathy and the rapport she builds with her patients. It's something you cannot learn, you have it or you don't, and she has it in abundance.  
I felt completely supported throughout the process and as a result was able to make informed decisions around next steps. I was so very lucky to meet with and be supported by Dr Naheed.

title: Excellent medical care
body: Met advanced practitioner Dan.  Very thorough examination given and tests carried out.  Plenty of reassurance given.  I was listened to and felt valued.  Excellent service and would highly recommend.

title: First class treatment
body:
I'm so impressed with the treatment I've received at Spamedica in Poole.
Everyone treated me with such kindness and respect, putting me at my ease and explaining all that was going to happen to me very well.
The building is super clean and fresh and there's hot drinks and biscuits available, for free!!
Oh yes, my eye sight is marvellous now too.

author: Tbarls
title: Your phone lines
body:
Your staff are great but your admin system is truly terrible.  
I had symptoms on Friday and had to wait til Monday to call you. I ended up on the phone twice, for over 40 minutes each time.  
I went to the GP to get them to call you.  
I missed a call because I was working, tried to call back, another 35-minute phone call.  
The amount of worry and fear and stress your phone lines caused me was unreal.  
Also annoyance that basic administration is done so poorly. There could be a form on your site that allows us to ask for a call back if we have symptoms, or even a whatsapp or text number.  
It wouldn't be difficult to create.  
Yes I have made some poor choices, but I lost an extraordinary amount of time yesterday, and was stressed and worried for most of it.  
In my view, administration shouldn't be punitive and cruel in this fashion.

title: First class service..
body: Each member of staff was efficient, friendly and reassuring. The procedure has been totally successful and has made a real difference to my sight.

author: Booster1
title: So grateful for what you do
body:
Unfortunately I have been suffering with chronic Pancreatitis for 8 years & after 10 months of being well & flare-free, I had a small flare-up.  
I was able to return home & look after myself once the pain was under control, so I would like to initially thank the Ambulance paramedics, they were both great guys & got me able to move again.  
I would also like to thank the A&E staff whose care over the past 8 years has been exceptional, more so on the night I was admitted full of fireworks injuries, also in a really restricted dept due to the building work.  
Well done everyone, myself & most other people are so grateful for what you do. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
York Teaching Hospital NHS foundation Trust

title: Excellent Care and Professional Treatment
body: I was booked in for an asthma review and from the moment I was called by the asthma specialist I was treated with courtesy, cheerfulness and the utmost professionalism.  I had expected a short check-up but the process was exhaustive.  The procedures and reason for each of the tests was explained and I was reassured that I was in good health.  I left confident that I had been properly examined and understood the options available should my condition change.

title: Excellent practice
body: My experience with SpaMedica was excellent very efficient and the staff were so friendly.the premises are very modern and very clean.

title: Great service
body:
Well done Windrush Surgery 
Called today seen today followed up in 2 weeks 
All staff treated me with dignity and respect 
Thank you

author: Mavros356
title: A&E Experience - Victoria Hospital
body:
I was taken to A&E Victoria by ambulance with suspected sepsis. Due to there being no beds available at Resus, I was instructed by a paramedic to attend the waiting room but was urged by same that I wouldn't be there long, as they had carried out a handover with nursing staff and that I would be triaged almost immediately.  
The waiting area was very busy, however the paramedics explanation did not become reality as despite having whole body pain, temperature of 39.4, and severe pain and redness in arm with tracking lines coming from same, I waited in the waiting room for just under two hours. My family had to alert staff five times that I was deteriorating in the waiting area and needed urgent help. Despite this, other patients who arrived after me were being seen before me and these patients were able to walk, talk, joking with family and eating snacks whilst I was on the verge of unconsciousness.A family member, who is a nurse, was with me the whole time had called the ambulance on the basis that I would be seen quicker once at A&E, despite them not wanting to make that call due to 999 being for emergencies where they are near to or are life threatening. This was reiterated by the attending paramedics who stated we had done the right thing and also to A&E receptionists by family. During the wait as my condition declined, my family member was told by a nurse that just because I was in via ambulance this does not give me the right for priority to be seen. I find this absolutely ridiculous that despite it being a query for sepsis, I had to wait two hours to be seen, over patients who were in a more fit state with less severe concerns.However, after the two-hour wait I was seen by the consultant on duty for A&E. After taking one look at me on initial triage,the consultant realized how serious it was and ushered me to Majors, where I was provided a bay and a bed to relax, where the consultant also explained the situation and course of action. I was then treated by a staff nurse, who I cannot commend enough for their care, attention and professionalism whilst supporting my family and treating me through a very traumatic experience for everyone involved.The consultant also checked up on me regularly and assured me I would be admitted and in good hands. I would like to reiterate that the consultant was remarkable in their professionalism and how they were able to take the time and care for me on a busy night.Prior to heading to my new ward, I was also met by the clinical fellow for Ward 33.They explained my course of treatment and stated that I would be put up to the ward for a course of antibiotics for at least 24 hours.I was appalled that despite being rushed in by ambulance on a priority call, I was left waiting in a busy, riotous waiting room for two hours whilst drifting in and out of consciousness and being overlooked by receptionists and the triaging nurses. Despite this, once I had made it through the door and into majors, the care was excellent. I am only thankful that I caught the cellulitis at its early stages, as time is precious for this sort of infection, and to look back and have lost two hours in A&E at crucial times is a scary thought, I hope no one has to go through this, as if it had not been detected until later and I had to endure that wait, who knows how bad the blood poisoning could have spread. Through, in my opinion, the fault of an A&E allocation/handover system. I strongly believe that patient condition should overwrite the first in, first seen mentality.

readBy.name: Office of Murdo Fraser, MSP for Mid Scotland & Fife

author: Sue eliza
title: My problem
body: I was meant to have an appointment to see a doctor about a problem I have. But after waiting for 45min found out I was just seeing a medical student, so I left, very annoyed! I have seen a medical student before and that wasn’t any good.

author: Mavros356
title: All the staff were so helpful and supportive
body:
I arrived within Ward 33 at Victoria Hospital to undergo a course of antibiotics for at least 24 hours as I had suffered an infection. From the moment I arrived until the minute I left, the care was outstanding. All the staff there were so helpful and supportive and couldn’t do enough for me.  
I can’t remember everyone's names, but the few that I remember was the Charge Nurse Emma, who was helpful and when doing my antibiotics and took the time to answer all the queries I had. The auxiliary was a lovely woman by the name of Carol and she was so helpful in anything that I needed, whether it was ice, food or water, she was able to get anything for me and always had a laugh with me and any family who were visiting.  
On the final day of my treatment I was looked after by a student nurse named Annie who took bloods from me, but she was also really helpful and chatty. If she did not have the student uniform, I would have assumed she had been qualified for some time.  
Once discharged, I left the ward feeling much better due to everything that the staff did for me.

title: Poor communication and department organisation
body:
I attended an appointment with my mother who had actually come into the gynaecology department. During this she was sent to have her leg checked due to swelling and a potential blood clot. 
For this we had to see a triage nurse so waited 2hrs in A&E, then she was sent to ACU for a scan. 
Here they took her blood, where she was told it had then gotten too late for a scan but she had to wait for her blood results. 
We waited from 18.30 - 21.30 where she still had been seen by a doctor regarding further appointments, at this point we were told she had to come back the following Monday for a scan, but without an appointment. Then on the journey she received a call to say she should have been given blood thinners before leaving. 

We returned Monday, waited during this time nurses wanted to go over the same checks as Friday, as if they hadn’t even checked her file. When she went for a scan she was then told she should have had an appointment and by chance they had fit her in, otherwise it would have been 17.00 for a slot bearing in mind we arrived for 9am to avoid the waits experienced on Friday. 

After this she was told there was no clot but was rudely told she had to wait 4 hours to see a doctor at which point we left. 

Overall communication was poor, the organisation of the ward was terrible, there was not privacy when doctors spoke to other patients as they were sat so closely in the same room, with no curtain and the fact the doctor had wanted to prescribe blood thinners before knowing if there was a clot is quite concerning. Not to mention treatment of other patient's on the ward that I witnessed. 
I appreciate the NHS is underfunded, with few staff that are overworked and underpaid but the lack of even what I class as general customer service skills is really sad, frustrating and worrying. 
Fortunately this isn’t my local hospital and I wouldn’t advise anyone to come here unless absolutely necessary.

title: Fantastic practice
body: The staff at Lionwood are wonderful; friendly, understanding and genuinely want to help their patients. The nurses and doctors are fantastic at dealing with nerves and are thorough and when it comes to investigating the problem. It’s easy to request appointments online and I’ve never had to wait long after arriving at the practice for an appointment. I cannot recommend this practice enough, I’m no longer anxious about going to the doctors. The staff are a real credit to the NHS.

title: Caring, confident commitment to primary healthcare
body: My GP took time to cover the complex context of my health needs. She explained evidence for treatment recommended in a way that helped me choose and we have a monitoring plan in place tailored to me and my lifestyle. Exemplary public health practice and not the first time I’ve received such kind support from this GP group.

title: Horrendous waiting times
body: Was referred for a scan after 7 months of waiting for a 10 minute phone call. Had the scan and the technician said that I would need a follow up scan in 5 to 6 weeks to monitor something potentially concerning that was found. I've now just been informed via patientsknowbest that this advice has clearly been disregarded and I'm going to have to wait 4 months for a phone call to discuss the results, yet in the meantime my symptoms have been getting worse. Absolute joke of a department, it shouldn't take that long to speak to someone when concerns have been raised by hospital staff.

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful treatment at A&E
body:
I want to share my appreciation to every member of staff on duty at Lister A&E on 5/11/22. My daughter was very poorly and was triaged very quickly. Very quickly after triage she was given pain relief. After seeing a specialist consultant she was given a multitude of drips and was constantly checked upon. In fact many of the patients in the waiting area were given drips with treatment. I have never seen this before. We needed to wait 12 hours for a bed to become available which is unfortunate but cannot be helped. The important thing is that treatment started in the waiting area and she was constantly checked on and made comfortable. The nurses and doctors looked exhausted, most were there the whole 12 hours, but continued to give everybody care rushing around constantly and with smiles on their faces. 
The 2,separate nurses in charge on the front nurses station we’re wonderful. I went to the front for regular updates and not once was I made to feel a nuisance. I received gentle reassurance and an apology for the wait. These people have nothing to apologise for. They are working above and beyond. 
It took 3 attempts to withdraw blood from my daughter as she was so dehydrated. She is very squeamish and has fainted while giving blood in the past. But the nurses who attended to her were so incredible at distracting her and even making her laugh that she was fine. 
There were two separate female patients who obviously were having a mental health crisis and were quite aggressive. They were treated with kindness, patience and respect. The second lady was particularly aggressive, was shouting profanities and became horribly racist. She was dealt with calmly but firmly with extreme professionalism. 
I honestly witnessed so much kindness and sincerity not only to us but other patients that I was quite moved. 
Please pass on my enormous thanks to all staff working at a&e on Saturday. They are all doing an incredible job and are beautiful humans. 
It does not go unnoticed and is so appreciated. 
As I said on a public forum, they deserve salaries ten times what they are being paid! Fingers crossed this new government will recognise this.

title: Absolutely wonderful
body:
I suffered a serious panic attack this morning, which went on for several hours and became very scary. 

Two paramedics called after a short time and were incredible. Their patience and commitment was second to none.  

Thank you so much. The world needs more like you!!

title: Great information
body:
I telephoned the Surgery following a hitch with my elderly Mother's prescription.
The Receptionist was so helpful and went over and above in her explanation of the re-ordering process.
She was patient and understanding throughout the conversation and offered more support if necessary

title: Best Services
body:
My husband received excellent care including the successful removal of several stage 4  liver tumours. We cannot praise this hospital enough.
Thank you to all the staff providing efficient, respectful service from the including the cafe, admissoons, porters, shop, nurses, surgeons and more.
Thank you doesn't say enough.

title: A credit to the NHS
body: I had a pacemaker fitted on Ward 27 on 18 October. All the staff were reassuring and helpful at all times. I was put at ease and everything was fully explained to me at the time. My cardiologist explained everything to me before the procedure, during the procedure and afterwards. The whole experience was a credit to the NHS and proof of why it should be properly funded.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Telephone appointment calls are not working
body:
I have requested numerous phone call appointments and I am unable to pick up the call as it says no caller id on my phone, and it doesn't ring and if press the answer button nothing happens. So, I then miss that appointment and have to book another telephone call because there are no appointments available at the practice.  This has been going on since the 25th of October. I have changed the contact number to my work mobile to see if that works and still no joy . Every time this happens, I have to wait for two weeks for the next available slot . Please can I get an appointment to see a doctor at the practice . 

kind regards 

Chris Miller

author: izarsk34
title: A very good experience
body: Ultrasound needed for suspected fluid build up after my mastectomy a week ago. Ulrika, the nurse present, was so lovely and encouraging, even letting me use her own arm to lean on, as raising mine into the air and holding it there was proving very uncomfortable, putting any discomfort of her own to the side to help me! All staff involved in the procedure were AMAZING !! Thank you
